page.title: 03Landscape In Brigmerston.
page.content: { Brigmerston}is a very small village in {Wiltshire}and is less than one kilometre long.Its lanes are very narrow without pavements.Trees are scattered along the hedgerow.There are lots of wild flowers like Primroses,Wild Daisies,Cow Parsley, Stinging Nettles and Bluebells.A few bunches of Wild Onion can be found there. {Housing}is quite varied dating from the late eighteenth century to present day.The older houses used to have thatched roofs and huge fireplaces with dome shaped ovens made out of flint.In one 200 year old cottage the most interesting room was{The Sitting {Room}because of its ceiling.It was 2.35 metres high.
